about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: You may cross double yellow lines to pass another vehicle if the:

hasPart.assesses: You may cross double yellow lines to pass another vehicle if the: | You may cross double yellow lines to pass another vehicle if the: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A broken yellow line in the center of the road indicates that traffic next to the broken yellow line may pass, if it is safe to do so.

suggestedAnswer.text: Vehicle in front of you moves to the right to let you pass.

comment.text: Vehicle in front of you moves to the right to let you pass.

suggestedAnswer.text: Yellow line next to your side of the road is broken.

comment.text: Yellow line next to your side of the road is broken.

suggestedAnswer.text: Yellow line next to the opposite side of the road is broken.

comment.text: Yellow line next to the opposite side of the road is broken.

acceptedAnswer.text: Yellow line next to your side of the road is broken.

comment.text: Yellow line next to your side of the road is broken.

answerExplanation.text: A broken yellow line in the center of the road indicates that traffic next to the broken yellow line may pass, if it is safe to do so.

comment.text: You may cross double yellow lines to pass another vehicle if the: | A broken yellow line in the center of the road indicates that traffic next to the broken yellow line may pass, if it is safe to do so.

hasPart.text: You must yield to pedestrians at all times. If the pedestrians are jaywalking or crossing the street where they should not be, you must still stop for them.

comment.text: Must stop for them.

suggestedAnswer.text: Do not have to stop for them.

comment.text: Do not have to stop for them.

suggestedAnswer.text: Should honk your horn at them.

comment.text: Should honk your horn at them.
Must stop for them.

answerExplanation.text: You must yield to pedestrians at all times. If the pedestrians are jaywalking or crossing the street where they should not be, you must still stop for them.

comment.text: If pedestrians are illegally crossing in the middle of the street instead of in a crosswalk, you: | You must yield to pedestrians at all times. If the pedestrians are jaywalking or crossing the street where they should not be, you must still stop for them.

hasPart.name: You reach an intersection with stop signs on all four corners at the same time as the driver on your left. Who has the right-of-way?

about.name: You reach an intersection with stop signs on all four corners at the same time as the driver on your left. Who has the right-of-way?

hasPart.assesses: You reach an intersection with stop signs on all four corners at the same time as the driver on your left. Who has the right-of-way? | You reach an intersection with stop signs on all four corners at the same time as the driver on your left. Who has the right-of-way? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If two vehicles arrive at the same time to an intersection that has stop signs on all corners, the vehicle to the right has the right-of-way.

suggestedAnswer.text: The driver on your left has the right-of-way.

comment.text: The driver on your left has the right-of-way.
You have the right-of-way.

suggestedAnswer.text: Whoever is signaling to make a turn has the right-of-way.

comment.text: Whoever is signaling to make a turn has the right-of-way.
You have the right-of-way.

answerExplanation.text: If two vehicles arrive at the same time to an intersection that has stop signs on all corners, the vehicle to the right has the right-of-way.

comment.text: You reach an intersection with stop signs on all four corners at the same time as the driver on your left. Who has the right-of-way? | If two vehicles arrive at the same time to an intersection that has stop signs on all corners, the vehicle to the right has the right-of-way.

hasPart.name: You must stop at the intersection ahead. Just before the intersection, you have to cross railroad tracks. You should stop before crossing the railroad tracks when:

hasPart.text: If you need to stop after crossing railroad tracks, wait until you can completely cross the tracks before proceeding. Make sure your vehicle clears the tracks before you stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: There isn't room on the other side for you to completely cross the tracks.

comment.text: There isn't room on the other side for you to completely cross the tracks.

suggestedAnswer.text: The crossing is located in a city or town with frequent train traffic.

comment.text: The crossing is located in a city or town with frequent train traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: You are transporting two or more children in a passenger vehicle.

comment.text: You are transporting two or more children in a passenger vehicle.

acceptedAnswer.text: There isn't room on the other side for you to completely cross the tracks.

comment.text: There isn't room on the other side for you to completely cross the tracks.

answerExplanation.text: If you need to stop after crossing railroad tracks, wait until you can completely cross the tracks before proceeding. Make sure your vehicle clears the tracks before you stop.

hasPart.name: You drive defensively when you:
hasPart.assesses: You drive defensively when you: | You drive defensively when you: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You are driving defensively when you are looking down the road for potential hazards. Constantly staring at the road directly in front of your vehicle is dangerous. As you scan ahead, be alert to vehicles around you.

suggestedAnswer.text: Put one car length between you and the car ahead.

comment.text: Put one car length between you and the car ahead.

suggestedAnswer.text: Look only at the car in front of you while driving.

comment.text: Look only at the car in front of you while driving.

suggestedAnswer.text: Keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards.

comment.text: Keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards.

acceptedAnswer.text: Keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards.

comment.text: Keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards.

answerExplanation.text: You are driving defensively when you are looking down the road for potential hazards. Constantly staring at the road directly in front of your vehicle is dangerous. As you scan ahead, be alert to vehicles around you.

hasPart.name: You must file a report of a traffic accident occurring in California when:

about.name: You must file a report of a traffic accident occurring in California when:

hasPart.assesses: You must file a report of a traffic accident occurring in California when: | You must file a report of a traffic accident occurring in California when: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When you have a collision, report it to DMV within 10 days if anyone was injured (no matter how slightly) or killed. You or your representative must make this report whether or not you caused the collision, even if the collision occurred on private property.

suggestedAnswer.text: Your vehicle fails a smog test.

comment.text: Your vehicle fails a smog test.

suggestedAnswer.text: You are involved in a collision and there is an injury.

comment.text: You are involved in a collision and there is an injury.
You change your insurance company.

acceptedAnswer.text: You are involved in a collision and there is an injury.

comment.text: You are involved in a collision and there is an injury.

answerExplanation.text: When you have a collision, report it to DMV within 10 days if anyone was injured (no matter how slightly) or killed. You or your representative must make this report whether or not you caused the collision, even if the collision occurred on private property.

comment.text: You must file a report of a traffic accident occurring in California when: | When you have a collision, report it to DMV within 10 days if anyone was injured (no matter how slightly) or killed. You or your representative must make this report whether or not you caused the collision, even if the collision occurred on private property.
